Key Match Events: India defeated Ireland by eight wickets in their first match of the 2024 ICC Men’s T20 World Cup.
Ireland set a target of 98 runs for India on a challenging pitch.
Arshdeep Singh took the wickets of Paul Stirling and Andrew Balbirnie early in the match.
Mohammed Siraj, Jasprit Bumrah, Hardik Pandya, and Axar Patel contributed significantly to India's bowling attack.
Gareth Delany and Josh Little formed a 27-run partnership for Ireland.
Mark Adair took the wicket of Virat Kohli for just one run.
Rohit Sharma scored 52 runs from 37 balls before retiring hurt.
Rishabh Pant scored an unbeaten 36 runs to lead India to victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York, USA.
The crowd of 20,604 was the biggest in US cricketing history.
